to speed up decision-making at the Internet giant. In a regulatory filing last week, Google said that Eric Schmidt in December drew up a plan to sell some of his stock in the company. The pre-arranged trading plan was adopted in order to allow Eric Schmidt to sell a portion of his Google stock as part of his long-term strategy for individual asset diversification and liquidity, the filing said. As of December 31, Eric Schmidt had about 9.2 million shares of Google stock and controlled 9.6 per cent of the company's voting power. Eric Schmidt plans to sell about 534,000

Jackie Walorski said she expected Mike Pence to abide by Mitch Daniels ' wishes. He and I are aligned virtually down the line on conservative and fiscal issues. I'm excited for any door Mike Pence walks through, she said.`` Obviously it'd be great for the state of Indiana.'' Mike Pence is from Columbus and was an attorney before running unsuccessfully for Congress against Democrat Phil Sharp in 1988 and 1990.

shake-up. Current Google CEO Eric Schmidt will serve as the company's executive chairman. Co-founder Sergey Brin will devote his time to strategic projects, in particular working on new products, the company said. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, Eric Schmidt said in a statement.`` By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company.
